content: I am a photographer and while in space I took pictures of the earth. Through my photographs, I hoped
I could inspire others and help them to see the planet in a different way.
When you look at the Earth from space, our planet looks like a little blue marble. Seeing our
world from that vantage point changes you.
The views are just incredible. Here are some photos I took from space:
<div>There aren’t fifty shades of blue to describe the Caribbean because its blues from space are so intense.
Turquoise, indigo, azure—I quickly ran out of words that would do it justice. I hadn’t anticipated such a
<div>Here is a picture of the Middle East. Egypt is on the left. It is separated from Saudi Arabia
by the Red Sea and from Israel by the Sinai Peninsula (the land between the two fingers of water).
This area has seen a lot of conflict. But all I could see from space was beauty, serenity—there were
no geographical boundaries. I couldn’t see the unrest, the fighting, the wars—just how close we are as
Here is a panoramic view of a portion of the Andes Mountains in Chile and Argentina. The thin blue
line you see around the planet is our atmosphere—that’s what keeps us alive.
This photograph shows my hometown, Lynchburg, Virginia. It was fun seeing where I grew up from
From space you can see how humans have impacted the land—city lights...
It's a fragile and beautiful place.
We should all take care to protect our Earth.
Art can change how people view things. Sometimes art focuses on beauty. Sometimes it can inspire
one person and sometimes many. It can bring the world together through its message. Art is self-expression
